result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenden T Lee

records.addlTxt:
Court reporter Tara Monthie. Defendant Brenden T Lee in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Brenden T Lee.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Leonard advises the defendant does not want him on this case any longer and wants to represent himself. Atty Leonard completes the right to waive an attorney with him. Court goes through colloquy with the defendant in regards to waiving his right to an attorney. DE advises that he no longer wants Mr Leonard to withdraw. 

 Court put this case on the trial calendar. DE given notice in hand for FPT, JS and JT.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Jury selection scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.

DE did not get notice in time for todays hearing. Court will reset plea hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Parties reached an agreement in this case and request plea/sentencing dates. DE given notice in hand for next hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

  Trial Judge - Br 17

04:13 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Trisha Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
